member.summary: Removes all active subscriptions.
member.remarks: Useful when resetting systems or shutting down the event entirely.

members.member:
Represents a typed game event capable of publishing payload data to subscribers.
The struct payload type used when publishing the event.
Subscriptions are tied to an owner object. Subscriptions automatically clean themselves up when the owner goes out of scope or is destroyed.
# Subscription Examples
## Godot
Here's an example of how to subscribe to an IGameEvent in Godot: \include Documentation/Examples/Nomad.Events/Godot/Player_Subscribe.cs
## Unity
Here's an example of how to subscribe to a IGameEvent in Unity: \include Documentation/Examples/Nomad.Events/Unity/Player_Subscribe.cs
# Publishing Examples
## Godot
Here's an example of how to publish a IGameEvent in Godot: \include Documentation/Examples/Nomad.Events/Unity/Enemy_Publish.cs
## Unity
Here's an example of how to publish a IGameEvent in Unity: \include Documentation/Examples/Nomad.Events/Unity/Enemy_Publish.cs

member.remarks: Categories show which part of a module/which system the log message is coming from to make tracing messages much easier instead of guesswork.

member.summary: The name of the category.

member.summary: The log level of the category.

member.summary: Whether the category is enabled. False means all messages sent with this category as a parameter will simply be ignored.

member.name: M:Nomad.Core.Logger.ILoggerCategory.QueueMessage(System.String@)
member.summary: Queues a log message into the category.
member.param: The message to queue.

member.name: M:Nomad.Core.Logger.ILoggerCategory.AddSink(Nomad.Core.Logger.ILoggerSink@)
member.summary: Adds a sink to the category.
member.remarks: By default, all sinks are added to a category, however, if you wish to control where a category can actually output to, utilize this method here to do so.
member.param: The sink to add.

member.name: M:Nomad.Core.Logger.ILoggerCategory.RemoveSink(Nomad.Core.Logger.ILoggerSink@)
member.summary: Removes a sink from the category.
member.remarks: By default, all sinks are added to a category, however, if you wish to control where a category can actually output to, utilize this method here to do so.
member.param: The sink to remove.

member.name: M:Nomad.Core.Logger.ILoggerService.AddSink(Nomad.Core.Logger.ILoggerSink)
member.summary: Adds a sink to the logger.
member.remarks: A sink is a dedicated output abstraction, that prints messages to IO outputs such as stdout, a logging file, or the in-game console. You can setup your own sink if you want to route log messages elswhere.
member.param: The sink to add.

member.name: M:Nomad.Core.Logger.ILoggerService.CreateCategory(System.String@,Nomad.Core.Logger.LogLevel,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new logging category.
member.remarks: A logging category is a denotation of where a message is coming from for easier debugging and tracing. You can also filter categories by enabling or disabling them as well as by .
member.param: The name of the category.
The log level of the category.
Whether the category is enabled. If false, any log messages sent with this category as a parameter will not send any messages to the sinks.
member.returns: The created logging category.

member.name: T:Nomad.Core.ServiceRegistry.Interfaces.IServiceLocator
member.summary: Provides a mechanism to locate and retrieve service instances from a service registry.

remarks.para: The interface defines the core functionality for dependency injection and service location within the Nomad Framework. It serves as the primary entry point for accessing registered services at runtime.
Implementations of this interface typically work in conjunction with an to resolve service dependencies based on their registration configuration (singleton, scoped, or transient).
This interface extends to allow proper cleanup of resources, particularly for scoped service locators that may need to dispose of scoped services.

member.name: P:Nomad.Core.ServiceRegistry.Interfaces.IServiceLocator.Collection
member.summary: Gets the service registry associated with this service locator.
member.value: An instance that contains the service registrations and configuration used by this locator.
member.remarks: This property provides access to the underlying registry for advanced scenarios such as dynamic registration or configuration inspection. Modifying the registry after service resolution has begun may result in undefined behavior.

member.name: M:Nomad.Core.ServiceRegistry.Interfaces.IServiceLocator.GetService``1
member.summary: Gets an instance of the specified service type.
member.typeparam: The type of service to retrieve. Must be a reference type.
member.returns: An instance of type .
member.exception: Thrown when no service of type is registered, or when the service cannot be resolved due to dependency resolution failures.

remarks.para: This method resolves the service based on its registration in the service registry. The lifetime of the returned instance (singleton, scoped, or transient) depends on how the service was registered.
For optional dependencies, consider using instead to avoid exceptions when a service is not available.

member.name: M:Nomad.Core.ServiceRegistry.Interfaces.IServiceLocator.TryGetService``1(``0@)
member.summary: Attempts to get an instance of the specified service type.
member.typeparam: The type of service to retrieve. Must be a reference type.
member.param: When this method returns, contains the service instance if it was successfully resolved; otherwise, .
member.returns: if the service was successfully resolved; otherwise, .

remarks.para: This method provides a non-throwing alternative to for optional dependencies. It returns instead of throwing an exception when the service cannot be resolved.
Note that this method may still throw exceptions for resolution failures other than "service not found", such as circular dependencies or constructor failures.

member.name: M:Nomad.Core.ServiceRegistry.Interfaces.IServiceLocator.GetServices``1
member.summary: Gets all instances of the specified service type.
member.typeparam: The type of service to retrieve. Must be a reference type.
member.returns: An containing all registered instances of type .

remarks.para: This method is useful when multiple implementations of a service interface are registered and you need to work with all of them (e.g., for plugin systems or event handlers).
If no services of type are registered, an empty enumerable is returned (not ).
Each call to this method may return new instances for transient registrations, depending on the service lifetime configuration.

member.name: M:Nomad.Core.ServiceRegistry.Interfaces.IServiceLocator.CreateScope
member.summary: Creates a new service scope.
member.returns: A new instance.

remarks.para: A service scope creates an isolated context for scoped services. Services registered as scoped are created once per scope and are disposed when the scope is disposed.
Scopes are particularly useful for web requests, unit of work patterns, or any scenario where you need isolated service instances with a controlled lifetime.

member.name: M:Nomad.Core.ServiceRegistry.Interfaces.IServiceLocator.CreateInstance``1
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the specified service type without using the service registry's caching.
member.typeparam: The type of service to create. Must be a reference type.
member.returns: A new instance of type .
member.exception: Thrown when the service cannot be created due to missing dependencies or other resolution failures.

remarks.para:
This method bypasses any lifetime management (singleton/scoped caching) and always creates a new instance. It is useful for:
Creating multiple independent instances of a service
Testing scenarios where you need fresh instances
Situations where you need to manage the lifetime manually
Unlike , this method does not return cached singleton or scoped instances. Each call creates a new instance.

The created instance will have its dependencies resolved from the service locator, but the instance itself is not tracked for disposal by the locator (unless its dependencies implement and are managed by the container).

member.name: T:Nomad.Core.ServiceRegistry.Interfaces.IServiceRegistry
member.summary: Defines a contract for registering and managing service dependencies in the dependency injection container.

remarks.para: The interface provides the foundational building blocks for configuring the dependency injection system in the Nomad Framework. It allows services to be registered with various lifetime scopes (singleton, scoped, or transient) and supports different registration patterns including type-based, factory-based, and instance-based registrations.
This interface typically serves as the configuration API used during application startup or module initialization, while serves as the runtime resolution API.
Implementations should ensure thread safety for registration operations if the registry may be accessed concurrently during application initialization.

member.name: M:Nomad.Core.ServiceRegistry.Interfaces.IServiceRegistry.Register``2(Nomad.Core.ServiceRegistry.ServiceLifetime)
member.summary: Registers a service type with its implementation type and specified lifetime.
member.typeparam: The service type to register. Must be a reference type.
The implementation type. Must be a reference type and implement .
member.param: The that determines how instances are created and cached.
member.returns: The service registry instance for method chaining.
member.exception: Thrown when does not implement , or when either type is not a concrete, instantiable class (for non-factory registrations).
Thrown when the service registry is read-only (typically after the first service resolution).

remarks.para: This method registers a service using its implementation type. The container will use reflection to create instances of when needed, resolving its constructor dependencies from the container.

The parameter controls the instance management:
: A single instance is created and reused.
: One instance per service scope.
: A new instance is created each time.
If is already registered, this registration will typically replace the existing registration. The exact behavior may vary by implementation.

member.name: M:Nomad.Core.ServiceRegistry.Interfaces.IServiceRegistry.Register``1(System.Func{Nomad.Core.ServiceRegistry.Interfaces.IServiceLocator,``0},Nomad.Core.ServiceRegistry.ServiceLifetime)
member.summary: Registers a service using a factory function with the specified lifetime.
member.typeparam: The service type to register. Must be a reference type.
member.param: A factory function that creates instances of .
The that determines how instances are created and cached.
member.returns: The service registry instance for method chaining.
member.exception: Thrown when is .
Thrown when the service registry is read-only (typically after the first service resolution).

remarks.para: This method allows custom instantiation logic for a service. The factory function receives an that can be used to resolve dependencies, but care should be taken to avoid service locator anti-patterns within the factory.

Factory registration is useful when:
The service requires complex initialization logic
The service implementation depends on runtime values
You need to wrap or decorate an existing service
The service implements multiple interfaces and you need to choose one
The factory function will be called each time a new instance is needed according to the specified .

member.name: M:Nomad.Core.ServiceRegistry.Interfaces.IServiceRegistry.RegisterSingleton``1(``0)
member.summary: Registers a pre-existing instance as a singleton service.
member.typeparam: The service type to register. Must be a reference type.
member.param: The instance to register as a singleton.
member.returns: The service registry instance for method chaining.
member.exception: Thrown when is .
Thrown when the service registry is read-only (typically after the first service resolution).

remarks.para: This method registers an already-created instance as a singleton service. The instance will be returned for all subsequent requests for .
The container will not manage the lifecycle of the instance (it will not call Dispose on the instance even if it implements ). It is the caller's responsibility to manage the instance's lifetime.

This method is useful for:
Registering configuration objects
Registering services that require specific initialization parameters
Integrating third-party objects into the DI container
Registering services that implement multiple interfaces with specific instances

member.name: M:Nomad.Core.ServiceRegistry.Interfaces.IServiceRegistry.RegisterSingleton``2
member.summary: Registers a service type with its implementation type as a singleton.
member.typeparam: The service type to register. Must be a reference type.
The implementation type. Must be a reference type and implement .
member.returns: The service registry instance for method chaining.
member.exception: Thrown when does not implement , or when either type is not a concrete, instantiable class.
Thrown when the service registry is read-only (typically after the first service resolution).

remarks.para: This is a convenience method equivalent to calling Register<TService, TImplementation>(ServiceLifetime.Singleton). It registers a singleton service where the container creates and manages a single instance of .
Unlike , this method lets the container manage the instance lifecycle (including calling if the implementation implements it).

member.name: M:Nomad.Core.ServiceRegistry.Interfaces.IServiceRegistry.IsRegistered``1
member.summary: Determines whether a service type is registered in the registry.
member.typeparam: The service type to check. Must be a reference type.
member.returns: if is registered; otherwise, .

remarks.para: This method checks if there is at least one registration for the specified service type. It does not check for multiple registrations or the specific implementation details.
This method is useful for conditional registration logic, where you might want to register a default implementation only if no other implementation has been registered.
Note: Some service containers support multiple registrations for the same service type (for ). This method returns if there is at least one registration.

member.name: M:Nomad.Core.ServiceRegistry.Interfaces.IServiceRegistry.GetDescriptors
member.summary: Gets all service descriptors registered in this registry.
member.returns: An of objects representing all service registrations.

remarks.para: This method provides access to the raw service registration data. Each contains information about a registered service, including its service type, implementation details, and lifetime.

This method is primarily intended for:
Diagnostic and debugging purposes
Implementing advanced container features
Building tools that analyze or visualize the dependency graph
Creating container snapshots for testing
The returned enumerable represents a snapshot of the registry at the time of calling. Subsequent modifications to the registry will not be reflected in the returned collection.

member.name: T:Nomad.Core.ServiceRegistry.Services.ServiceLocator
member.summary: Provides a thread-safe implementation of the interface for resolving and managing service instances with singleton, scoped, and transient lifetimes.

remarks.para: The class is the core dependency injection container implementation in the Nomad Framework. It manages service instances according to their registered lifetimes and provides efficient, thread-safe resolution of dependencies.

Key features:
Thread-safe singleton caching using
Thread-local storage for scoped instances (one scope per thread)
Factory caching for performance optimization
Automatic disposal of services
Constructor injection with recursive dependency resolution

Note: This implementation uses thread-local storage for scoped instances, meaning each thread gets its own scope. For web applications or other scenarios requiring request-based scoping, consider using to create explicit scopes.

member.summary: Gets the service registry associated with this service locator.
member.value: The containing all service registrations used by this locator.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified service collection.
member.param: The containing service registrations.
member.exception: Thrown when is .
member.remarks: The service locator takes ownership of the provided collection and will dispose it when the locator is disposed. Do not use the collection after passing it to the locator.

member.name: M:Nomad.Core.ServiceRegistry.Services.ServiceLocator.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the and all disposable services it manages.

remarks.para:
This method performs the following cleanup:
Clears all singleton, scoped, and factory caches
Disposes the thread-local storage for scoped instances
Disposes the underlying service collection
Disposes all singleton and scoped services that implement
After disposal, any attempt to use the service locator will result in undefined behavior.
This method is idempotent; calling it multiple times has no additional effect.

member.name: M:Nomad.Core.ServiceRegistry.Services.ServiceLocator.CreateInstance``1
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the specified service type without using the container's lifetime management.
member.typeparam: The type of service to create. Must be a reference type.
member.returns: A new instance of .
member.exception:
Thrown when:
No public constructor is found for
Any constructor parameter cannot be resolved from the container
The service type is abstract or an interface

remarks.para: This method creates a new instance using constructor injection, resolving all dependencies from the container. However, unlike , the created instance is not cached or managed by the container (except that any dependencies resolved during construction are tracked by the container).

This method is useful for:
Creating multiple independent instances
Testing scenarios
When you need to manage the instance lifetime manually

The instance is created using the first public constructor found. For types with multiple constructors, the behavior is undefined. Consider using explicit factory registration if you need control over constructor selection.

member.name: M:Nomad.Core.ServiceRegistry.Services.ServiceLocator.CreateScope
member.summary: Creates a new service scope for resolving scoped services.
member.returns: A new instance.

remarks.para: A service scope creates an isolated context for scoped services. Services registered with are created once per scope and are disposed when the scope is disposed.
The returned scope uses a separate instance cache, so scoped services resolved from the scope are independent of those resolved from the parent locator or other scopes.
It is the caller's responsibility to dispose of the returned scope. The recommended pattern is to use a statement.

member.name: M:Nomad.Core.ServiceRegistry.Services.ServiceLocator.GetService``1
member.summary: Gets an instance of the specified service type.
member.typeparam: The type of service to retrieve. Must be a reference type.
member.returns: An instance of .
member.exception: Thrown when no service of type is registered.

remarks.para:
This method resolves the service according to its registered lifetime:
Singleton: Returns the same instance for all calls
Scoped: Returns the same instance within the current thread/scope
Transient: Returns a new instance each time
For optional dependencies, use instead.

member.name: M:Nomad.Core.ServiceRegistry.Services.ServiceLocator.GetServices``1
member.summary: Gets all instances of the specified service type currently cached in the singleton cache.
member.typeparam: The type of service to retrieve. Must be a reference type.
member.returns: An of instances from the singleton cache.

remarks.para: This method only returns instances from the singleton cache. It does not create new instances or include scoped or transient services that are not cached as singletons.
If no singleton instances of are cached, an empty enumerable is returned.

Note: This implementation differs from typical dependency injection containers that support multiple registrations of the same service type. This method only returns singleton instances that have already been created and cached.

member.summary: Creates an instance of the specified type using reflection and constructor injection.

member.exception:
Thrown when:
No public constructor is found
Any constructor parameter cannot be resolved

remarks.para: This method uses the first public constructor found (by reflection order). For types with multiple constructors, consider explicitly registering a factory to control which constructor is used.
The method recursively resolves all constructor parameters from the container. Circular dependencies are not detected and will cause a stack overflow.
If the created instance implements , it is tracked by the service collection for disposal when the locator is disposed.

member.name: T:Nomad.Core.Util.Any
member.summary: A type-safe container that can hold any of the supported primitive types. Similar to C++'s std::any, it provides a unified way to store and retrieve different value types in a memory-efficient manner using a union structure.

remarks.para: The struct occupies exactly 20 bytes of memory regardless of the stored type, using an explicit layout union to share the same memory space.
This type is particularly useful in scenarios where type erasure is needed while maintaining type safety through explicit conversion or retrieval.

member.name: T:Nomad.Core.Util.InternString
member.summary: Represents an interned string, providing efficient storage and comparison of string values.

remarks.para:
An is a lightweight value type that stores an integer identifier pointing to a unique string instance in the global string pool. This enables:
Reduced memory usage for duplicate strings
Fast equality comparisons (integer comparison instead of string comparison)
Efficient hashing (the identifier itself serves as the hash code)
Interned strings are managed by the class, which ensures that identical strings share the same storage and identifier.
This struct implements for efficient equality comparisons without boxing. See the remarks on the method for details.

member.name: M:Nomad.Core.Util.InternString.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct with a specific identifier.
member.param: The identifier of the interned string in the string pool.

remarks.para: This constructor is typically used internally by the string interning system. For user code, prefer the constructor that takes a of characters or use implicit conversion from strings.
Note: This constructor does not validate that the identifier corresponds to an existing interned string. Using an invalid identifier may result in undefined behavior when the string is accessed.

member.name: M:Nomad.Core.Util.InternString.#ctor(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct from a character span.
member.param: The character span containing the string value to intern.

remarks.para: This constructor interns the specified string value in the global string pool. If an identical string is already interned, the existing identifier is reused.
The interning process may allocate memory in the string pool if the string is not already present.

member.name: F:Nomad.Core.Util.InternString.Empty
member.summary: Gets an empty instance.
member.value: An instance representing an empty string.
member.remarks: The empty has an identifier of 0, which is reserved for the empty string in the string pool.

member.name: M:Nomad.Core.Util.InternString.Equals(Nomad.Core.Util.InternString)
member.summary: Determines whether this instance and another specified are equal.
member.param: The to compare with this instance.
member.returns: if has the same identifier as this instance; otherwise, .

remarks.para: This method provides an efficient equality comparison by comparing only the integer identifiers, avoiding string comparison entirely.
This method is aggressively inlined for performance.
Implementing prevents boxing when comparing instances in generic contexts or collections that use the interface.

member.name: M:Nomad.Core.Util.InternString.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether this instance and a specified object are equal.
member.param: The object to compare with this instance.
member.returns: if is an and has the same identifier as this instance; otherwise, .
member.remarks: This method is aggressively inlined for performance.

member.name: M:Nomad.Core.Util.InternString.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.
member.returns: The identifier of this interned string, which serves as its hash code.

remarks.para:
The hash code is simply the integer identifier, which provides:
Perfect distribution (each interned string has a unique identifier)
Consistency with equality (equal instances have the same hash code)
Minimal computation (the identifier is already available)
This method is aggressively inlined for performance.

member.name: M:Nomad.Core.Util.InternString.op_Implicit(Nomad.Core.Util.InternString)~System.String
member.summary: Converts an to a regular string.
member.param: The to convert.
member.returns: The string value represented by the , or if the identifier is invalid or represents an empty string.

remarks.para: This conversion looks up the string value in the string pool using the identifier. If the identifier is invalid (does not correspond to an interned string), is returned.
This method is aggressively inlined for performance, though the underlying string pool lookup may involve a dictionary lookup.
